Reviews.Title: “Unique place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cutecdnchick
Reviews.Content: Lots of history here, so much to explore and if you stay as a guest you have full rein of the gym, all 5 or 6 floors of it! I lived here for a month back in 2006 when there was a delay in my apt building opening. I liked it then, but love it now since it's been renovated. I stayed here for my wedding weekend in Feb/12 as did over 30 of my wedding guests. Everyone loved the hotel, the service, the location and the rooftop! Highly recommend. Excellent pricing too. Teri in group services was the best to work with. Oh and the free breakfast is SO good, hot and cold items, not just continental.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bobwins
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I booked the LAAC to attend the Pac12 basketball tournament at Staples Center. The hotel is about 1 mile away so within walking distance. The building is definitely older but has been remodeled and kept up to date while still retaining the feel of an older era. The room was large by current standards. The long desk was very convenient. The LCD TV was mounted on one side while the other side was perfect for my laptop, with power connections and the free WIFI. The King bed was very comfortable, with a cushy but firm pillow top. The included breakfast buffet was very good. Lots of fresh fruit, scrambled eggs that were not dry from the warming pan and made to order omelets. Checkin was a little slow but overall service was good and the staff was friendly. The room rate was not cheap but I was very happy with this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel, even better for the sports buff”
Reviews.Author: tpinet
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little taken back that my wife booked us into an "Athletics Facility" but upon arriving I was instantly charmed. They kept the old-school boys club look on the restaurant floor which was very cool to behold. Lots of sports facilities (yoga, squash, full basketball/volleyball gym, length pool, sports shops, bar and lounge, etc). We loved the dark feel and all the decorations. The pictures of the 1920's dudes flexing kept us amused when we were exploring every floor. Rooms were excellently decorated and very clean. We had a king bed and it was a very comfortable sleep. Good AC unit which I used, to my wife's displeasure, since they kept the rooms a little warm for my taste but I am from Canada :D We had our breakfasts included and that was a personal favorite. The omelet chef is a genius...best omelets ever. Full buffet with lots of healthy options including yogurt and fresh cut fruit, milk, juice, etc and the bacon, sausage, eggs, french toast staples as well. We never had dinner here so I can not speak to that. Great location since the Metro is just 2 blocks away and you are right in the Jewelery District. Pretty close to Macy's as well. Also, when staying here definitely do not miss the opportunity to go to Bottega Louie across the street and get the Chicken Parm (biggest I have ever had). I have nothing but the best to say about this place and will probably stay here again if we come back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Facility”
Reviews.Author: eliana23
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous decor that reminds me of MAD MEN, with a dark men's club feel. Only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the bathrooms seem to have missed the modernization trend. As noted in some reviews, LAAC is right in downtown LA so there are homeless people around especially at night. But less than a mile walk to the disney concert hall, near fabulous restaurants, and a good value. I'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite downtown hotel. In house babysitting $2 per hour WOW”
Reviews.Author: Scubashark0822
Reviews.Content: So use of athletic club facilities, two free hot breakfasts with omelet station, $2 an hour in house child care, and great food and service. This is our new downtown hotel. Room service at room in 15 mine and was great. The whole place has a cool dark wood antique design which makes it so unique. Parking garage is attached and easy to get to lobby from. There is no tipping anywhere including restaurant and room service. We might have gone around that rule.... it reminds me of the day when hotels treated you as a king and family member. Fruit and cheese plate in room. Bed was so comfortable. Wasn't used to not having anywhere to spend money as they don't nickel and dime you. Internet free as well. Great place to stay on business and turn it into a family trip. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “"Best Stay of the entire 3 week trip"!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers396
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the LAAC for 3 nights on our way home from a 3 week west coast holiday. When we arrived the week after christmas the hotel lobby was filled with lovely christmas trees and a giant real ginger bread house. The staff we very helpful and welcoming and directed us to some great resturants with 2 min of the hotel. Our room was on the 10th floor and although this is the first floor of 3 for accomodation it was fabulous. Very soundproof and inpecibly clean. The best thing about the club were the sporting facilities. With 3-6 floors filled with gyms,spas,basketball and volleyball courts, spuash and handball, lockerooms, lovely swimming pool and a 2 lane running track. THe breakfast was also great. It is held in a lovely room with an omlet and waffle chef along with cold and hot food. This club is in a great location close to maceys,cafes, jewellery district and lots of public transport. If we ever come back to LA we will not think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: DMTM
Reviews.Content: I'm more than a little reluctant to review this hotel, just in case everyone discovers it. Hidden downtown within easy walk of Staples Center and theaters, this understated hotel is fantastic. Huge rooms and suites, full access to the sporting facilities, and free breakfast (unusual in US) and internet. The Athletic club itself is a huge fitness facility with everything you could ask for x 10, The locker room attendant seemed a little daunting at first but turned out to be super helpful, as we're the front desk staff at all times. There is no valet parking, but there is a covered multistorey car park next door with easy access to the hotel, and it's cheap with validation. The only downside of this stay was the closure of the swimming pool for maintenance and renovation without any notice to either my travel agent or myself when I booked. It had been a major reason for the stay, (along with the location near The Orpheum Theater) so that was disappointing. However pool overhaul should be completed by now and it is huge. Everything else was so good this aberration was soon overlooked and forgiven. Not the glamour of Hollywood, and a little rough on the streets after dark, but none of this matters if you need a discreet bolt hole downtown. Great bar half a block west too, Seven Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: PoisonedIvy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during our honeymoon and were very happy with our choice. Oscar and Ernie from the front desk are amazing. Oscar recommended us some fine restaurants and Ernie amused us with his stories about Vegas while we were waiting for our taxi. The room was great - big, warm and high quality materials. On our first day the cleaning ladies brough us a fruit basket. I love the fact that there is a seperate vanity area between the bedroom and the bathroom! The Spa is kind of old fashioned - but very welcoming after a day of wlking around LA! The location is also great, very close to a metro station. We didn't try the fitness. Our only complaint was the breakfast. It was not so good, and Mario (who seemed like the staff member in charge) was not very friendly. We ate way better at the Hyatt hotel. If we'd ever come back to LA, i'm pretty sure we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...I don't think so”
Reviews.Author: Del102102
Reviews.Content: (A warrior traveler for work her and fitness enthusiast) When looking for a hotel in downtown I wanted to find something that had a descent gym so that I wouldn't have to fight traffic just to go to a 24hr fitness. So this hotel sparked my interested when I did my research. PROs: Awesome fresh complimentary breakfast. Nice spacious rooms with comfortable beds. The pool was awesome CONs: It is a "private club," therefore you are constantly harrased for your ID/where you are going etc. I suppose the fact that I am t-shirt/short work out dress type of guy doesn't help. So on that note, if you intend to go for their "happy hour" it is a business attire (blazer and tie) dress code. When you check in they give you a pamphlet with all the "rules" etc. This place was just too uptight for my liking. I like to come and go as I like, be very casual, etc. The whole parking situation was a little confusing first. I got one answer from the check in person and when I was leaving the first time to get something to eat, I got an impatient answer as to the whole process of leaving in and out of the garage from someone in the club office and then the attendant. FYI, that area of town gets very shady at night so I wouldn't recommend walking out of the hotel. I will not stay at this place again. I think I'd rather drive myself to the gym vs the convenience of the inhouse gym and incovenience of the "stuffyness" of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great club like feeling”
Reviews.Author: litaltomo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, pleasantly surprised with the style and quality of the rooms. The room was large and spacious, huge cumfy bed, clean bathrooms. The staff were very helpful and very easy to deal with. The whole building felt very safe with only club members and guests being allowed in. The feeling that you have with this hotel is very "Mens Club" in now way implying only men are allowed, but the styling and emphasis on rules-rarely enforced and the big leather club lounges whisky bar and so forth. Defenatly recomend this place for something more than just a hotel BTW- As the name of this hotel suggests it is a gym as well- *Amazing* facilities although i didnt use them at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: annereviews
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a function in downtown L.A. and discovered this gem of a hotel. I was a little worried about my choice at first, as the lobby was just okay. The lobby has a dark green carpet that has seen better years, and the front desk staff aren't in a hurry to provide quick check-in service. Once we got to our room I realized that a hotel can't be judged on first impressions alone. We were given a beautiful corner room that was oversized, glamorous, and oh so comfortable! The room had a king bed with Frette linens, the bathroom had Frette towels, and there were two Frette robes in our closet - aaah comfort. The decor of the rooms is very designer, and at a rate of $140 a night -including breakfast for two -this is a secret worth sharing.

Reviews.Title: “LAAC - Excellent Downtown Find”
Reviews.Author: TheHonestWord
Reviews.Content: Whenever I have a need to stay in DTLA, the LAAC hotel is a top choice when they aren't sold out and their rates are decent. If they keep their rates between $140-170 this is a good value for the quality of rooms provided. Yes, the rooms here are dark but well appointed and quite cozy and offer free Wi-Fi and a fruit tray and mints upon your arrival. Their themed suites are a bonus for the novelty but not worth the extra money; your best value lies with the Deluxe King. Check-In here can be slow as more times than not I only see one person occupying the front desk so allow yourself some extra time if you are in a hurry. Self Parking is in the structure next door and a great value compared to some other properties in DTLA. Overall, it has a great charm value, gives an asserted effort to detail, is clean, and definitely worth a visit if the price is right. I've stayed here on numerous occasion and have yet to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Old-school comfort - a different kind of hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: SSEFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and enjoyed it. Located at the heart of downtown Los Angeles, so a good base to start from (including close to Metro stops with quick connection to Hollywood). Quite an old-school, traditional atmosphere (in a good way) especially in the public areas. Rooms are modern and very comfortable. Mine was a little dark. Bed and bathroom all of a high standard, though I had to ask for hand soap which was missing. Breakfast included in price, omelettes made to order Monday to Friday were a real plus. Sports facilities great. Overall a very different kind of experience, it really feels like an athletic club with hotel attached and not the other way round - this may not suit everyone, but I liked it. Staff helpful and courteous, in an understated way.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous98103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I highly recommend the LAAC. We spent our first night in LA at a different hotel but switched to the LAAC after a negative experience at the other hotel. Terry was fantastic to deal with over the phone, and the other staff whom we encountered were cheerful and helpful. This place has a lot of character, a great view from the roof, a fantastic breakfast, and is conveniently located. We did not have a car but were able to easily and inexpensively get around town and to LAX using public transportation. The downtown area seems to be experiencing a resurgence and we had no problem finding several nice restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. My husband and I live near and frequently travel to large cities and felt perfectly comfortable walking around the neighborhood in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: oblos
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown, rich breakfast available until 10.30AM with the best omelettes! I really loved the style of the rooms and the staff is always kind and attentive. Pool, squash courts and a basketball/volleyball court available. If you like sports this is the very hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Walter O
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly when I'm in L.A. on business. It is very convenient to downtown business and there are some very good restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are old but were been renovated a while back but this definitely not a 5-star resort. The athletic club, which has a very active local membership, has a rich century plus old tradition and is noted for awarding the Wooden Award to the best college basketball player every year. The reasonable rates reflect the accommodations, which while not bad are not at the level of the Bonaventure or other similar destinations. A very good breakfast is included. One inconvenience that you should be ready for is that when parking in the parking garage, you have to take two elevators to get to your room and you have to negotiate you luggage up a short flight of stairs, approx. 4 steps. This is not that difficult but it is inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money spent!”
Reviews.Author: Creasians
Reviews.Content: Expensive for the kind of place it is. Several issues here that you may want to be aware of. During my first 3 night stay here, night 1 went by just okay as I was exhausted after work and checked in late. Night 2, coming back from work..I noticed the room TV turn on and off by itself, as much as once every 2 minutes. Called the front desk and they were helpful to change my TV. 30 mins after it started happening again and this time they changed the satallite receiver box. Once again it started turning on and off when I called the hotel staff and they gladly put me in another room 1/3 the size of my original room. Was the old room inhabited already? The hotel only told me that this place was a 1880 property and anything could be possible. Night 3, some serious rumbling and cutting noises in the walls. Called the front desk and they said someone was taking kickboxing classes and would pack up soon. Bedcovers removed to sleep..noticed it spread out on the used bed as is and the bed not even made up! Shocking!! This place is unacceptable. I must also mention the location. Not suitable for the faint of heart. The place is flooded with homeless right outside the door and you'd see them for as far as your vision would go. Cant think of taking late evening walks outside. However, the only single positive experience I had here is the good quality breakfast. Without a doubt, this was good breakfast that most hotels may not offer free.

Reviews.Title: “Old school charm in a relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: Knikol
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in our first visit to Los Angeles. The overall experience was great, the staff is helpful and polite, our room was spacious(two queen beds) clean and nicely decorated. the parking much cheaper that other hotels in LA. We had a noise problem with our first room, they were very understanding and changed us to a quiter room on the other side of the hotel. I think the LAAC has the potential to be a really great hotel if they only pay attention to some small things. For example, breakfast was healthy and tasty but kind of the same thing every day and that's so easy to fix. The hotel has such a relaxing feel to it, that the noise from the street becomes such a turn off. Just change the windows and the problem is solved. I would definitely stay there again, if i am back in LA, cause LAAC is more than a hotel, is a private club that accepts guests and you really feel lucky to be accepted. I just wish I had more time to enjoy the wonderful and free sport facilities. Next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaAS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 4 different nights in 3 different rooms, and they were all quiet, recently renovated and very nicely decorated. The hotel is walking distance to many sights, some restaurants and bars. Guests can take yoga and other classes, as well as use the athletic facilities. The hotel serves a good (and free) breakfast, and the bar on the third floor is very cool and hosts happy hour. My friends and I took one of our drinks to the rooftop where we had an amazing view of downtown. I did love the hair and shampoo products, but my one complaint would be the towels; they weren't very fluffy/soft but instead more on the scratchy side. Also, the jacuzzi in the women's locker room needs a facelift, as it is a little dingy and old. The dry and steam saunas were good, however! I will definitely go back to the LAAC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Trav34268
Reviews.Content: This is a little hidden gem in LA! After flying 14 hours from Australia all we wanted to do was crash and relax. We arrived at the hotel not knowing what to expect....we were very pleasantly surprised. We were only there for one night but after enjoying it I wish we had stayed for a couple of nights. Great facilities (pool and gym) and large nice, clean and comfortable room. The view from the roof top was great. We sat up there and watched the sun set over LA, which was great. There's a 7/11 across the road and very short taxi trip to the LA union station train station. The hotel has a real retro feel about it. Great way to start your time in the USA .

Reviews.Title: “Enormous room!”
Reviews.Author: jorlaur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our trip to the US and were very pleased with the accomodation. The rooms were absolutely enormous -ours was a king which had an interconnecting door to a 2 x double bedded room for our 2 kids. We could have all easily fitted into one room and still had room to spare. We thought the location was fine, as it was close to the exhibition centre and also close to the metro station to catch a train to Hollywood. The facilities within the hotel are also good, with plenty of exercise options for those who are keen. Breakast was complimentary and had plenty of variety. We had dinner one night at the bar downstairs which had a good atmoshere but the food was average. The restaurant Louie Bottega was only a block away and was a good dinner option. All in all a good start to our holday and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in downtown LA. The room was comfortable although a bit dark. The good things are free wi-fi and free breakfast. The environment was generally quiet and comfortable, however the traffic around the hotel can be a bit noisy especially in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay. Amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: Beth C
Reviews.Content: I used trip advisor to find this hotel. If you are not picky about where you need to stay in LA I highly recommend the LAAC. The hotel is located downtown in the jewelry district. There are amazing neighborhoods close by, and we felt very comfortable walking during the day. It was our first stay in LA and the LAAC upgraded our 4 night stay. We ended up in the UCLA Bruins suite for $178 a night. Free breakfast was included for both of us. Breakfast was a full buffet...amazing. We also had a 4 day pass to the athletic facilities, which were beautiful. The service was wonderful. The hotel is small enough so that employees recognize you, and they were all very kind. I was very impressed how comfortable I was. Our room was very quiet and clean. The halls have a lot of room for sitting and gathering. Overall I couldn't have been more happy with our stay. Also hats off to the front desk staff that helped us check in and out in the middle of the night. So friendly for 3 am. Oh...and $12/24 hour parking!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great breakfast and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Urban-Sombrero
Reviews.Content: The LAAC is a very nice hotel, great staff, and very nice rooms. The hotel has a roof terrace, which we used for evening "warm ups" but it is bring your own... ie no bar. I had an athletic suite, large room with a mini gym. The breakfast was the best I have had travelling in the US. Complementary wifi is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, mediocre staff”
Reviews.Author: Diegodad2
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed in this hotel in the last six months. I come back because the rates are reasonable and the room, although quite small, is very stylish (if one exempts the old, cracked tile in the bath area). I'm increasingly frustrated with this hotel as it seems to go downhill every time I stay there. First, the public areas of the hotel are usually unkempt and dirty. It looks as if the carpet is only vacuumed once a day or maybe even less. The furniture is usually spread out without any order and the lobby generally looks like it gets the attention of a cheap residential hotel rather than having the attention of a fine hotel. Second, the Front Desk is a pig sty. When one stands there, there are papers, printers, shoes, boxes, magazines and the door to the office is usually open, allowing a view to the chaos behind. It's no wonder the staff is perfunctory if these are the standards that are expected by the management team. Third, the housekeeping is mediocre. In my last three stays, I've complained twice about the poor housekeeping (btw, each time I check in, I find hair in the bathroom. When I call, I've twice been told the tile is cracked and I should look again to make sure it's hair!). This time, I chose not to complain about the gum on the floor my socks kept sticking to, or the hair on the sink and in the tub, rather than deal with the surly response. I also didn't complain about the spinning sink faucets that had to be adjusted just so to stop the water flow. Fourth, the Front Desk staff could not sound less interested in you if they tried. Calls to the Front Desk are answered in a rude tone, the staff seems very eager to get you out from in front of them. They are unprofessional and lack polish. I'm sure they are kind people away from work, but their professional demeanor is sorely lacking. Finally, the rooms are showing dramatic wear. This time, my room had a very damaged desk, peeling wallpaper, scratched up walls, incredibly dusty surfaces. I had to move a table to plug something in and found old food under it where no one had cleaned. I also had two missing light bulbs (and, having learned my lesson, did not complain!). I'm a huge fan of little hotels and this hotel makes me sad. It is beautiful, but so disappointing if one is an experienced traveler. It has all the trappings of a great little boutique, but delivers so poorly that one is unsure if one should return. I just hate to see all the effort of restoring a landmark go to ruin so quickly. Frankly, it's a 3.5 star product with 1.5 star service. I'm really puzzled why one would spend millions on a renovation and not renovate the training level of the staff. I'm undecided if I will stay here again, but, if I do, it will be with great trepidation.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Dyova
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible for fitness-focused travelers: guests have access to an outstanding range of exercise facilities in a very low-key but upscale environment. The rooms are beautiful and recently updated. Lighting in the rooms is a bit dark -- it might be an issue if you need to do a lot of work in your room or apply makeup properly for brighter places. Free healthy snacks (bananas, apples, cheese and whole-grain crackers) are left in your room each day, and the free breakfast buffet is incredible. With an AARP or similar discount, the value is amazing. It's in the heart of downtown, and easy walking to many restaurants, clubs, etc. The only downside is that the neighborhood gets pretty deserted after dark, and if you arrive in the evening there's not much open in the surrounding blocks: slightly eerie to walk around at night by yourself in an urban ghost town. But that's the case in much of the downtown business area. Overall, a very pleasant stay in nicely appointed rooms: definitely a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, iffy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: NHSDteacher
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a "stay 2, get the third night free" promo, so this turned out to be an exceptional value. The room was excellent, as was the breakfast (included). Downtown LA is not a fun (or well-populated) place to be at night, so the walk from the metro to the hotel was a little stressful. Take advantage of the adjoining parking garage--much safer. My only other criticism--My wife says that the decor and soaps/shampoos provided are a little too masculine, not unisex. Overall, I recommend the place--especially at the 3 for 2 price.

Reviews.Title: “The yummiest bed in town !"”
Reviews.Author: jswjunk
Reviews.Content: This recently upgraded hotel property has the most luxurious bedding available. The downtown location is superb, staff is very helpful, and the facilities are well kept. Consider that this property was built in 1912 as a gentleman's club, and has been lovingly tended ever since -- remarkable. It is a rare treat to be able to visit such a prestigious facility and spend time in a world where world class athletes have trained for years. The breakfast isn't the fanciest you'll ever find, but the servers are attentive and the room is lovely -- in fact, make a point to notice the wood paneled walls all over the club and the art collection housed in this facility - it is impressive. The ballroom, bar, and meeting rooms are very inviting, and natural light abounds. Take a few laps around the indoor track, as you look down on swimmers in the beautiful indoor pool. Or indulge in a yoga, aerobic, or swim class while you're there. I have been visiting this club for years, and have been very pleased to see upgrades going forward on various floors -- soon the main dining room will be fit for royalty !! The setting is perfect for weddings (I've seen quite a few over my years staying there as a hotel guest), because you can do the ceremony and dinner there, while your guests can simply hop in the elevator to return to their rooms for the night. Brilliant !! Treat yourself to a real, historical downtown Los Angeles experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great access to public transit”
Reviews.Author: sipari_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June to attend the Usher concert at Staples Center which was in walking distance. We didn't rent a car and found it very easy from this location to take the bus to the Grove shopping centre and the hotel staff told us which bus to take and provided a map. Also took the subway to get to Hollywood Blvd. and took the bus to Santa Monica and back, it's a long ride but we saved a bunch instead of using cabs. The rooms are nice and clean and the bed was comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky gem in a great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: brick_one
Reviews.Content: This is a 'club' with the hotel rooms added. Travel by car from LAX was easy and on-site parking ($12 per day with in/out) was excellent and great value. We were upgraded on arrival to one of the themed suites (Athletic) which provided a separate seating area. Equipment and fittings are excellent. The rooms are somewhat noisy as this is downtown and the traffic noise can be intrusive but for us this didn't detract. The Club facilities are being renovated but the snack bar, Sports Bar all provided great service and were very welcoming. The major attraction are the sports facilities; gym, basket ball court, pool , spa etc - all great and if you're sport orientated this is a fantastic facility. Again staff are very welcoming and you feel right at home very quickly. Transport is all around you - the subway connected us to an event at Kodak Theatre in Hollywood for $1.50 each way and you can walk anywhere downtown from the central location. Included breakfast was great value and the range on offer extensive. All in all this was a great experience and I would strongly recommend this hotel as offering a welcome different hotel experience in an area that is being constantly enhanced and offers much to see & do.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown LA: hidden gem for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: traavel74
Reviews.Content: If you need to be in downtown Los Angeles, then this is a great option for travelles. $180 nightly rate included: WIFI in room Breakfast buffet Use of LAAC fitness facilities (if you want to work out, now hotel gym can compete) The rooms were recently remodelled and very clean. The only downside of the room is that the bathroom is fairly small. Think of a boutique hotel in an older building in the heart of the city. The location is not the best in downtown Los Angeles but you can easily walk to public transportation, bars and restaurants in less than 5 minutes and the conference center is a 5 minute cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay if you need to be downtown; bonus use of athletic facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Yatrik1
Reviews.Content: Included use of the athletic facilities is reason enough to stay at LAAC, but the room was very nice too. It was pleasant, quiet and clean, although not too spacious (it's an older downtown building). Every staff person I encountered was very friendly and helpful. I suppose it was probably a little pricey for just the room, but when you factor in the use of the facilities and breakfast, it's reasonable. LAAC is located in the Jewelry District which was surprisingly more lively (both day and night) than I'd expected. It's apparently quite the neighborhood to shop for jewelry. There are some good restaurants within walking distance, as are banks, bars, a Walgreens, etc. A block away there's a little alley between jewelry stores that is home to some fun persian/mediterranean restaurants, although the one I tried was not very good. A metro station is a 5-10 minute walk away, but I doubt that's a consideration for most guests here. I guess for the price I'd stay here again if I had to be downtown and wanted to use the athletic facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: inga518
Reviews.Content: Great downtown L.A. hotel. Only 72 rooms, all on the upper 3 floors of a 12 story classic building. The room was very masculine, dark walls, no frilly fabrics, subdued. Modern updated features, chrome and black desk, Eames style work chair. Nice bath products. It struck me, you normally have tiny little openings in the shampoo/conditioner/lotion bottles...these bottles had wide openings, again, it appeared that they took the time to find toiletries with men in mind. I was a single woman staying there and loved that. The bed and linens were superb. The rate included a buffet breakfast and it was delicious. White table linens, great coffee, juice, eggs, excellent bacon, french toast, potatoes, cereal, yogurt...the works. And, access to any and all of the athletic club, pool, basketball court, weights, etc. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value far exceeds any quirkiness...”
Reviews.Author: EFW333
Reviews.Content: The charming and historic L.A. Athletic Club is my first choice for lodging in downtown Los Angeles. Having stayed at least a dozen times over the past six months I can honestly rate the property as a great value, in fact it's a steal, all things considered. Has every stay been perfect? No. Spending on average 50 nights a year in hotels and motels I have had many disappointments with 5 star properties and pleasant surprises at 2 star mom and pop country inns. Therefore I shake my head when I read scathing reviews by someone who pays $160 for a room and expects to find high-end amenities and somersault service associated with a room at three to four times that price. The professional staff at the LAAC is absolutely first rate, the breakfast one of the best associated with any hotel I've found and the rooms clean, modern and exceptionally comfortable. Frankly, it's a prestigious private club that's currently kind enough to allow non-members full access, something guests should be appreciative of, in my well-traveled and humble opinion.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to like this place but...”
Reviews.Author: Quinoa50
Reviews.Content: After reading the nice reviews here, I decided to book a couple of nights for my business trip. The interior was pretty nice, but the room was very moldy and the air was 'heavy', which exacerbated my sinus problem. The breakfast was included, but they didn't allow me to carry out a banana which I was trying to save for an afternoon snack because it was 'against their policy' (as if the customers would know about this). This stinginess continued on with the room service. They didn't have toothpaste in the room so I called the front desk. The guy who answered told me that the toothpaste tube they had was too small and 'only good enough for one brushing' and then asked me whether I still wanted it or not. This made me feel that they didn't even want to give me that small amount of toothpaste. So I went out and bought a $1 tube from the pharmacy nearby. The maid service was another interesting thing. I saw that their carts didn't have many extra towels, which made me think that there weren't a lot of customers on my floor. But then I realized that they were recycling the old towels (the ones that I put on the floor after using). This was subtly done as they were folded and hung again as if new. I have no problem reusing old towels, but the hotel again seemed to have forgotten to inform me of this 'policy'. Had I known, I wouldn't have placed the towels on the floor after using them. And finally, they NEVER refilled the basic room amenities such as shampoo, conditioner and body soap for the entire 4 days I stayed there. By the last night, I had only 1/5 of the shampoo left in the 1.5 oz bottle, but I felt too tired to deal with these people by that point that I just added water to the bottle to make enough bubbles to lather my hair. I just couldn't bother anymore. I think the hotel invested a lot in updating the interior because everything 'looks' nice. However, in the process, I think they forgot the most important thing in hotel management--SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen0801
Reviews.Content: Our original room was needed that night so we were bumped up from a normal room to a suite, and boy were we grateful! I am a 6-foot-two female and no matter how I was lying on the bed with my friend(lounging or sleeping), I never ran out of room. The space of the main bedroom was remarkable as well! My friend and I easily fit all of our luggage into the room (I'd say about 7 suit cases (and that's not including my friend's sewing machine!) with PLENTY of room to spare. Throughout the course of two nights, we had called the front desk for many things, ranging from rushing bandaids to our room, calling a taxi, or asking to hold one of our roommate's bags until the next morning. Everything was done in a timely manner (it seems as if they had already prepared everything and were just waiting for our call!) and we were always served with a smile and a pleasant attitude. I highly recommend taking the Club up on their breakfast. I, sadly, could not enjoy the hot food due to a morning sickness that I had that weekend, but I enjoyed the other options that they had there and from what my friend said from the hot food, she was extremely pleased with it. The servers were always on top of it and cleared our plates as soon as they saw that we were finished. I would definitely stay in the hotel again and I would recommend it to everyone that was considering staying in the downtown area for any sort of event.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations on every level-- superb!”
Reviews.Author: desertgirl6
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently celebrated our domestic partnership with a ceremony and reception in downtown Los Angeles. We wanted a nearby hotel for our guests and began our search with the Biltmore. The reservation agent I spoke with was rude, sounded bored, and refused to offer us a group rate without an assurance that "at least a good amount" of our guests would pay extra for suites-- something that was impossible to foresee and put us in the awkward position of badgering our guests to "upgrade" their rooms-- no, thank you. A quick Google search of other hotels in the immediate area led us to the Athletic Club. I have lived a few miles from downtown LA for twenty years. My partner and I are moving away soon, and one of the biggest regrets I have is not having discovered this incredible place sooner. From my very first email with Ms. Teri Onorato, their director of hotel sales, I was charmed. Teri is gracious, funny, detail-oriented and extremely hard-working. She offered us a fantastic and very competitive rate for our guests, she extended the rate through the whole weekend (prompting many members of our party to stay two and even three nights) and she was an asset to our event from start to finish. Before we had even SEEN the hotel I said to my partner, "I almost don't care what it looks like as long as organizing it is this easy". And the hotel--!!! The 3 floors of rooms were re-done in the past two or three years, and re-done perfectly. The combination of comfort, glamor, and history is just spot-on. This is not a generic "luxe hotel" experience, this is a deeply personal LA institution. Let's be clear: this is a unique place in every way. It's not Le Meridien; it's a vast old gym and clubhouse that's 130-plus years old and has an amazing hotel attached. One of our guests, delighted, said, "It feels like we're staying in your very eccentric rich uncle's mansion, and he loves us". That about covers it. This is Wes Anderson territory in the best way...our guests felt they'd been part of an adventure, which is just what we'd hoped for. We swam in the massive indoor pool, we used the excellent gym and sauna facilities, we walked around downtown and pretended we were tourists at the museums, bars and sights. Oh, and the hotel offers the best free breakfast-- eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, at least half a dozen kinds of fresh fruit, multiple granolas, yogurts and pastries-- excellent. At the Fairmont in San Francisco they charge thirty dollars a head for a breakfast that is only slightly bigger than this one. From an organizational perspective, high marks again: all of our gift bags were delivered with check in, special needs were anticipated and accommodated, including a handicapped-accessible shower, and it all went off without a hitch....bravo! This is the perfect hotel for a longer stay, and a perfect "home base" from which to explore the city-- we will be returning as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, location, and amenities”
Reviews.Author: nonna070
Reviews.Content: The top three floors of the LAAC have recently been renovated into beautiful, spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed rooms. The middle floors are devoted to the LA Athletic Club's basketball court, pool, weight rooms, exercise rooms, and fitness rooms and hotel guests may use everything - no limits, fee, or exceptions. The staff provides the most excellent service and does so cheerfully and instantly. The location on Seventh near Olive is ideal for exploring downtown LA. The LAAC is in the heart of the jewelry district and within a few blocks of the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Walt Disney Concert Hall, and the Central Library. The rates are very reasonable for the location. And, it comes with a full hot breakfast! Don't even consider staying elsewhere if you need to be in Downtown LA!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, atmosphere, setting, value in the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: TimFino
Reviews.Content: The staff at the LAAC went above and beyond the call of duty to help our group (of 15 rooms). Service was outstanding - the complimentary breakfasts (including custom made omlets) were a very welcome treat. Atmosphere and overall decor was at a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need in One Place- LAAC!”
Reviews.Author: cataylor84
Reviews.Content: I was invited to the LAAC in March by a friend who was hosting her 25th Birthday party there. When I first heard we were going to, "The Los Angeles Athletic Clubâ€� I have to admit I was a little confused. I thought to myself why we would go to a workout athletic club for a party? I didnâ€™t ask many questions since the girl hosting the party is the most popular person I know in LA and I just went with it. I later found out the LAAC was not only a gym but also a hotel, bar, lounge, restaurant, and a venue for many weddings, parties, social gatherings the list goes on and on. When my buddies and I got to the LAAC we took our own little tour and saw they had Squash and raquet-ball courts which was heaven! Come to find out the club has been around for about 150 years and has a lot of history. I found myself wishing I would have gotten a hotel room just to check out the place a little more. I eventually made my way down to the party which was a blast! The hotel staff was very friendly towards our group and I am thinking about looking into becoming a member since I am in the downtown area all the time. I did a little research and to become an actual member of the club is a good way to meet great people living in LA and seems to be high class. Great place overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in January”
Reviews.Author: bucko_35630
Reviews.Content: The slick web site fooled me. This is a relaxed environment in which to stay. If you need everything sparkling new you may be disappointed, but I loved it. Great breakfast, good location, great workout facilities, and friendly staff. I left some things there and they shot them to me as soon as I called. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Rude manager, poor fitness center hours, mold”
Reviews.Author: travelinfromla
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for a night away from the baby based on its seeming perks: close to restaurants, a fitness center and pool. I arrived at 3pm check-in with the idea that I'd work out, swim and enjoy the pool while my husband would meet with me later. Be warned: MAJORITY of the rooms are ADJOINING. Immediately upon entering my room, I was disturbed by the blaring of the neighbors tv. I phoned the front desk requesting a non adjoining room. I was assured no one was in the next door room. Yet, immediately after I got off the phone, I could hear the phone ringing next door. Why call if no one is there? I intercepted the worker who went into the room to turn off the tv, and he said my neighbor was 'out' and had left the tv on. I again requested of the front desk I would prefer a non-adjoining room. After a 15 minute wait, the staff member showed me to another room...only this one had a queen bed and btw, was still ADJOINING. So instead of accommodating my request, I was put in the same type of room with a smaller bed â€“ I donâ€™t get it. After waiting 20 minutes for the worker to return with the second room key (he had taken my orig keys, and not given me the second room keys), I carried my luggage all the way down back to the front desk, and asked to speak the manager (Alberto.) He waved me over and proceded to tell me their rooms were â€˜mostlyâ€™ adjoining. I mentioned again that I would like a non-adjoining bed with a KING bed not queen â€“ which is what we had paid for... I was firm but polite. HE asked me if I had trouble sleeping or was a light sleeper? Actually, when I choose a hotel, I prefer NOT to hear the goings-on of my fellow hotel guests. I don't think I'm alone in this preference. He left me standing there for another 10 minutes without talking to me or telling me he was trying to accommodate me. After clearing my throat several times to get noticed, I finally managed to get his attention. He begrudgingly said he could put me in another room, but that it would need cleaning. And I would have to wait for another 35 minutes. Fine. I didn't care at this point. Just a clean room, with a king size bed where I can't hear my neighbors phone ring. After I mentioned I would go to the gym, and come back for a key for my husband Alberto asked "Where is your husband, anyway." ??? The implication and tone was that I was 1) inept, 2) a woman and 3) not worth dealing with. I was embarrassed and ashamed, and I have rarely felt more discriminated against and invalidated than in that moment. Now, to be fair, I have a different last name then my husband - so maybe he thought I was an escort or having an affair? By this point, it's 4:50, I'm in street clothes in the lobby, and the gym and pool close at 5:30! On a Saturday! So, if you are going for a swim or workout, be forewarned. For a club based around fitness, they have terrible weekend hours â€“ hotels.com stated that there is no room service on weekends, but not the early gym closures. My husband managed to speak to the GM, who apologized for the mishaps, put us in a suite, and sent us a bottle of champagne, but I can't help but feel that the GM is responsible for the lack of skill and customer service of the staff. I would not pay to stay here again. The lobby and elevators were worn and dirty. The rooms themselves were clean, but in all three rooms I saw, mildew and mold were evident on the ceiling tiles in the bathrooms. I have also never seen a pool in more need of a re-grouting. The LA public pools are better maintained than Los Angeles Athletic Club. Save your money, go elsewhere for a quiet, restful experience. Or a swim in a clean pool.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed, value for money and a hotel that cares”
Reviews.Author: CJ313
Reviews.Content: I am traveling on a holiday across the US and we choose this hotel due to its price, decor and good reputation on trip advisor. We were not disappointed and were very impressed with the choice. The service provided by the front desk was warm and felt like they genuinely cared instead of a man/woman in a sharp suit but with an arrogant and blase attitude. The front desk were helpful in providing directions and both check in and check out was efficient. I might just add that we were also upgraded to a king size bed for no cost or apparent reason at check in other than the fact that we got off a 15 hour flight and looked probably like we had no sleep. A plate of welcome fruit was also provided. In terms of the room, if you are a fan of the more classical looking decors, this one would suit you fine. The photos on websites/trip advisor does it total justice. The complimentary gym is great and as good as any commercial gym (well it is a commercial gym) and the complimentary breakfast was good enough given it was free. Also, free Wall street Journal for those who care. Only con's - could provide more toiletries as we were running low but they weren't replaced. For those who are particular - the bathroom does show a few signs of aging but more than usable for my standards. Overall, this hotel felt like it wasn't big enough to be arrogant and cared about its customers, provided the amenities we needed, great service, great price, great location if downtown is where you want to be and one of the few hotels that i have visited globally that I'd say had true historical character. Well done guys! ps - girlfriend wanted me to add in that its proximity to transportation both Pershing Square and 7th Street Metro makes travel to other parts of LA (including Disneyland) effortless

Reviews.Title: “really great”
Reviews.Author: Tripp21
Reviews.Content: I had business in downtown LA and stayed here. It was all that I had hoped for. I was upgraded upon arrival, the room was spectacular. The pool was incredible and the rest of the sports facilities were amazing, I was sad to not to be able to just work out all day. The location is good but downtown LA is still not completely there in terms of city settings. The hotel staff were genuine and super helpful. If you really like a great gym and want a great night sleep this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Never Come Back to This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vamegh
Reviews.Content: We have reserved a room (fully paid) for seven nights in THE LOS ANGLES ATHLETIC CLUB with following details: Check in: 16, March, 2011 Check out: 23, March, 2011 Due to some problems in our trip plan and after more than 18 hours flight ,we received to hotel at 17,March 2011 but unfortunately the reception staff ( Mr. Alberta) told us that they have not any empty room for us and they cannot return my money also. He said that my money is in the hotels.com pocket and i had to find another hotel to keep my family relaxed. We left the hotel and went to the SHERATON DOWNTOWN that was near. Three days later we received our money with an apology email. Now my questions are: 1-Who is responsible for this event? I believe the los angles athletic club hotel should keep my room free because i have never informed them to cancel my reservation, and i completely pre paid for one week. 2- When my money come back to my bank account?

Reviews.Title: “Unique and beautiful -- a lovely hotel within a fantastic athletic club!”
Reviews.Author: CALtravelmom
Reviews.Content: I went to a conference held at this hotel, not sure of what to expect. What a great place! Especially if you like one of a kind, historic, beautiful old buildings! This hotel was built in 1880 and has, in addition to beautiful, comfortable rooms on the top floors, a beautiful pool, fabulous cardiac work out areas and a full size basketball gym! The decor is sports photos and memorabilia with elegant wood paneling -- a beautiful building. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Guests are able to use the athletic club facilities (no fee for the cardio area and pool and probably other areas too). There is a restaurant within the facility, but I did not get to try it except for breakfast on this trip. Did go to nearby Louie's and Fire Station #28 (both great dining choices). This is a gem of a hotel and athletic club. Loved my stay! Next time I'll try the spa!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: marksb2k
Reviews.Content: We attended a play at the Ahmanson Theater in the Music Center area of LA and didn't want to drive two+ hours home after, so we booked a room at the LA Athletic Club. I didn't expect much, actually, but WOW this place is a treasure in downtown LA! What was great: The room was clean, didn't smell of disinfectant, was reasonably soundproof for an old building, was decorated nicely in a old-school elegance style. The bed was firm, the bathroom was functional and clean, and the air conditioning worked well. There was a coffee maker, microwave, and refrigerator, along with plenty of drawers, nice furniture, and a decent-sized closet. The lights were decent--not too bright, yet enough. A nice flat-screen TV and an ipod-docking clock radio rounded out the amenities (though we didn't find the time to watch any TV :^) A fruit and cheese plate was delivered in the evening, and housekeeping was nice and responsive. The best part of this place is that it's an athletic club first and a hotel second. This is the original health and fitness club in LA, the only place the elite went back in the day, before a health club was on every corner--and it shows. It's a beautiful facility with everything you could want. My wife and I spent several hours lifting, running, swimming laps in the 25-yard indoor pool, spending relaxing time in the sauna and steam room (men's and women's separate in the locker rooms, but really clean and well maintained). The equipment was top-drawer. The attendants and trainers were friendly and helpful. This is the best fitness center I've been to in a long time--it's nearly a high-end spa. Cons: Really, nothing at all, other than the fact that this is an early-20th century downtown LA building, and probably could suffer significant damage when the Big One hits.... Well worth a try if you need to stay downtown. It's on 7th near Olive, in the jewelery district, so it's reasonably close ($6 taxi) to the Music Center and Ahmanson. If you love to relax in a nice room, and yet have a good workout the LAAC is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise Luxury with a capital "L" with out the price”
Reviews.Author: soaper28
Reviews.Content: What a surprise this hotel was, We booked this hotel because of what we had read on this site and stayed in a suite the hotel put us in the country suite, it was just so lovely, the decor was well thought out and had lots of detail, that I had not seen before in other hotels, (nice touches for example, a small putting green in the room ) The bed was sublime, and we have stayed in a lot of hotels to compare it with. FRETTE bed linen and Towels no less wow!! This hotel also comes with the added bonus of having great fitness facilities Loved the decor in the bar and restaurants they had a very old school club-by look to them, The food is not their strong point and has limited hours for room service in the weekends, but don't worry as there is a wonderful restaurant across the road called Louis, which is quite large and very very busy, which has amazing food., and great prices. Overall very impressed with our stay here, we were at a trade show at the convention center so it was very handy for us. Only down side and nothing to do with the hotel is its location downtown Los Angeles, not the best area. But don't let that put you off this hotel, any where in the world this hotel would be considered Luxury with a capital L

Reviews.Title: “wow.”
Reviews.Author: ababychicken
Reviews.Content: Checking in at the lobby desk made me fear the worst, but once I reached my room on the 11th floor, it was like hitting the jackpot! The rooms are very masculine but luxurious. I had one of the suites with its own living room. The city views made me feel like I was back in Chicago. The hotel offers a free breakfast in the restaurant every morning and it had lots to offer. It was also great getting to spend some time in the revitalized downtown area...so much to see! Make sure you have dinner down the street at Bottega Louie, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Classy luxury in the heart of the Downtown Fashion District”
Reviews.Author: auntieadriene
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here on the great reviews on Tripadvisor. We did not regret it at all. The room is reasonably sized with great modern yet classy decor. It is a dark wallpapered look so very different from your usual run of the mill hotel chain. Great lighting fixtures, albeit overall a bit dim. The room we stayed in (1212) was on the top floor and overlooked LA LIVE which was a litle distracting cos they had rotating search lights all night which shone over nearby Ritz (how those people staying there took it I wouldnt know). During our stay, the rooftop was closed for maintainence sadly. Whilst we did not know much about the history of the club itself (very illustrious indeed) it was clear that it was a proud heritage that the hotel took pride in keeping up. The room amenities were good and very suited for a business type hotel. From observing other guests, it was clear that many business travellers stayed here very regularly. The breakfast spread was adequate and in a very posh dining room with great attentive service. The downside was that the parking arrangement was slightly inconvenient. We arrived with alot of bags (at the end of a 3 week trip around California) so we pulled up into the carpark and there were no lots til 6th or 7th floor (with the entrance to the hotel itself on the 1st floor) so we had to turn around back down. The staff were incredibly friendly and directed us to park to the side of the entrance to the car park and unload (10 min). But what we didnt know was that there were lots of steps down to the front lobby of the hotel itself (the parking garage was to the back) . I would suggest, if you are checking in with your own car and lots of stuff, to pull up at the front and unload first and then park later. Similarly, car parking for guests per night was US$12 so they had to issue a car park slip separately which we had to then exchange and validate with the car park attendant each time we had to leave (so we could leave for free). A slight inconvenience which could have been dealt with better, but small issue. Because we had a car, location itself wasn't that important (we stayed at Hollywood and Venice on earlier days) so we wanted to try downtown. Definetely not touristy like the 2 previous locations but it worked for us as we wanted a quiet last 2 nights of our busy busy trip (mostly for packing). Bottom line, the hotel itself was absolutely great and met all expectations. Could improve on the parking arrangement but minor issue, if any.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in Anaheim but this location was equally convenient for this trip and we found a great deal on Travelzoo. I had never been to downtown LA before and it's not the greatest area but homelessness seems a big issue for every city now anyway so it was fine. No issue walking to the Staples Center but dabbed it back for $7. The parking setup was perfect. Staff were very friendly. The hotel was very charming with lots of wood panelling. The room was very modern though with an LCD and cable with channels like HBO. The roof terrace was amazing, takes up the whole roof overlooking downtown. Our room was very close by and one night obviously a fair amount of drinking was going on up there but the noise was very minimal. The bed was very comfy and a large bath with shower head. The in room safe was fine to throw in all our stuff. The bathroom could've been a bit cleaner. That and no toilet paper replacement during our stay had me really wanting to rate this just a 4.5*. Breakfast was great. Staff were very nice, great large tables with fresh juice, lots of fruit (melon, pineapple, etc), yoghurt, muesli, 4 different milks, scrambled egg, sausages, bacon, Danishes, etc. My partner liked the gym. I was a bit worried about the dress code that the gym website states but it wasn't an issue just for breakfast. We would definitely stay here again if we got the same deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place to Stay in the Heart of Downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife, who swims several times a week, regards the Los Angeles Athletic Club as a great pool with a hotel attached. To me, it's a neat old place right in the middle of Downtown LA, which is a neat old place itself. Since I last reviewed the Athletic Club, they've renovated the rooms and improved the hotel staffing. The rooms are pretty large with attractive dark furniture they describe as "clubby." If you're looking for room service you won't find it, but there are several dining rooms within the building. They include breakfast in the rate, the cooked food is plentiful but mediocre. I went out to Bottega Louie, a great restaurant/cafe block away at 7th & Grand, to get coffee--they open at 6:30 on weekdays. We had a car this trip--the parking rate is up to $12--which is a bargain by Downtown LA hotel standards. There's not much on-street parking in Downtown LA. It's also an ideal spot for car-free travelers, since the subway is a block away, there are DASH buses around the Downtown, and buses to every part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place downtown”
Reviews.Author: Solushan
Reviews.Content: Came to LA to catch the Roger Waters concert at Staples. Rates nearby at JW Marriot and Ritz Carlton were a little more than I wanted to spend. What a great find to discover the LA Athletic Club! Loved it, old school clubby feeling and the rooms were beautiful. We enjoyed the facilities and could have spent all day working out. 7 blocks to Staples which made for a decent walk and an easy cab ride. Neighborhood is " emerging" with several cool restaurants opening. We loved the sushi at Sugarfish 1 block from hotel. We had a nice snack waiting for us in our room when we returned from the concert. There was a coffee maker in the room and breakfast was wonderful. I will definitely stay here next time I am in LA. Thanks Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “Great Athletic Club with a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joel_in_dallas
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to downtown LA and wanted to workout while I was there but I didn't want to run around LA at odd hours by myself. I found a place called the Los Angeles Athletic Club which offered hotel rooms as well. It seemed perfect. And it was. I live in Dallas so I was up very early and could workout before my conference. The facilities are excellent. I mainly used the track on the 7th floor and could see people doing laps on the 6th floor and people playing basketball on the 6th floor while I was running on a banked track which is about 200m or so. My coworkers used the treadmills, weights, and pool. The breakfast that came with the very nice rooms was excellent. The WiFi was excellent as well. The staff was very nice as well. It was perfect for what I wanted while on my business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous with one small but important exception.”
Reviews.Author: designfan49
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for several days this month. What a unique and elegant place. Our room was beautiful, large and elegant, the free breakfast was delicious and generous, the common rooms and athletic facilities are beautifully restored and maintained. There is a romantic and nostalgic quality that reminds one of expensive private clubs of another era. The only problem? THERE WAS NO COFFEE AVAILABLE FROM ANY SOURCE OTHER THAN THE 7-11 ACROSS THE STREET BEFORE BREAKFAST WAS SERVED (no room service, no coffee pot in lobby, no coffee maker in room). WHO WANTS TO GET DRESSED AND CROSS THE STREET IN DOWNTOWN LA JUST TO GET A CUP OF COFFEE? Since only three floors of this lovely club contain hotel rooms, it would be SO easy and convenient to place a coffee service in the elegant, marble elevator lobby of each floor beginning at 6 AM and to maintain it until 8 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Amzing hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: cherryem
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at almost every hotel in downtown L.A. and this hotel is by far my favorite for the price. The rooms are newly renovated and the beds were very comfortable. I had read other reviews that the rooms are small but the rooms with 2 queen beds are large. The breakfast was great and the service was fantastic. I will defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nicely renovated historic place”
Reviews.Author: Kalisbon
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay downtown, then this is a great choice. Built in 1912, the Club is an actual athletic facility with rooms on the 10th-12th floors. Since it's not a hotel, there are limited hours for the restaurants and athletic facilities, especially on weekends. So if you're counting on using the pool during your stay, then call ahead for the schedule. That being said...the King Deluxe room I had was just like the photo. It's nicely decorated with Restoration Hardware fixtures and fittings and Frette sheets and towels. The only thing I would note is that some may find the decor a bit dark: brown linen wall paper, brown carpets, etc. so you may want one of the other rooms that have a different decor scheme, but don't look as nice on the website (didn't see them personally). The common areas are well-decorated with California impressionist and other original paintings and portraits from the late 1900s through the 1940s (I think). The athletic facilities are stae of the art, and there's a rooftop sundeck, which I didn't personally see, but was used for a wedding one night (my room was so quiet, I heard no noise at all from the wedding). Loads of free channels on the flatscreen. You're given a nice bowl of fruit (nothing rare and exotic, but fresh) at check-in and the breakfast buffet in the morning is very filling: cereal, yogurt, fruit and french toast (weekdays there are omelet and waffle stations). The service in the restaurant is outstanding and very attentive, even though I had a voucher which stated that a tip at breakfast was unnecessary. The only other thing I had at the Club was an excellent tuna melt in the sports bar. The Club is close to publc transport-- a block away from the Santa Monica 10 express and near the 7th Street and Pershing Square Metro stations. It's also close to Bottega Louie, 7 Grand and other trendy nightspots as well as a Big Lots. It's reasonably close to the Staples Center as well as a Ralphs, so if you don't feel safe walking around at night, a cab wouldn't break the bank. Again, if I needed to stay downtown again, I'd definitely stay here. Great atmosphere but, again, remember: it's not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved My Stay--Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dorav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Los Angeles Athletic Club last night and couldn't have been more pleased. Great room, great beds, extremely nice staff from front desk to dining room wait staff. I wish we had time to use the athletic facilities. Very interesting place with loads of character. I would definitely return and have already told friends and family about our wonderful stay. I usually don't write reviews, but this place is special. Got a great deal on Travelzoo, but I'd return and pay full price. If you're looking for a place with class that isn't your cookie cutter hotel don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters1010
Reviews.Content: The LAAC has proved to be a pleasant surprise because it is a club rather than a hotel and is there for the benefit of the members. Your price includes free (excellent) breakfast, room safe, free internet and reasonable parking rates. To top this, the rooms are fabulous, big with great decor and safe with great TV facilities free and pay channels as well as a large swimming pool and fitness facilities. Yes, the area is not outstanding, but it is just fine with convenience stores nearby and itâ€™s easy to get to the Metro. If you want to go further afield hire a car. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie72
Reviews.Content: Excellent and interesting. I took advantage of the athletic facilties and had a first-class facial. The parking is cheaper than most downtown garages. When I told my seatmate (a native Angeleno) that I was staying downtown, he said, "Cool! People don't know how great downtown is getting!" The room was swank for the price, and the service was excellent, including a little fruit and cheese in the room on arrival. An episode of "Mad Men" had been filmed in the pool area (very 1930s looking) the week before. I heard all about Don Draper from the spa staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Red_26101
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot in my life and this is by far the best hotel I've stayed in (besides the Bellagio-which you can't compare it to because of the price difference.) The staff - every single one of them were so nice and helpful. It's located in a great neighborhood - I felt safe walking to different restaurants, etc in the area. The parking was reasonable and a short walk to the hotel. The hot *free* breakfast was by far the best free breakfast I've had in my life. The hotel was gorgeous, the room was luxurious with everything you could possibly need and they even give you a fruit plate upon your arrival. If I travel to L.A. again, I will most definitely stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “All you are looking for and locals too.”
Reviews.Author: JanneKH
Reviews.Content: LA Athletic Club is a great choice for downtown LA. Rooms are well appointed (dark tones) and comfortable. (Bathroom is comfortable but not anything to rave about.) Free WiFi, discounted in/out parking, and tasty buffet breakfast are all positives. Another thing I enjoyed is the presences of real locals in the public areas. This is a working gym for those hardy souls who live in downtown. The only small negative is that the (Woman's) locker rooms are badly in need of update. Everything was clean / functional... just less than impressive.

Reviews.Title: “I lucked into this hotel by accident”
Reviews.Author: Etheline
Reviews.Content: And what a lucky accident it was. The staff was very friendly and helpful and everything about the hotel was above average. The room we had was very large, with an exercise machine right in the room. Parking was less than $9/night, compared to $25 or more in most downtown hotels. We had access to all of the club's facilities, however we did not take advantage of them. The breakfast was superb and served in style. The chef was very friendly and stopped and visited with us each morning, where our breakfast was included in the price. The man who checked us in was very helpful in making a room available, even though we were early, and then recommended a place for us to go for lunch while they finished cleaning the room. We definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in an unusual place”
Reviews.Author: HK_Observer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get away from the chain-hotel ambience, and this place was a GREAT alternative. The rooms were recently renovated, and they are really 5-star quality. Almost everything about my room stay was top-notch. As noted by other reviewers, some of the "club" areas are a bit worn, but this was not at all true of the "hotel" areas. Be aware, though, that this is not a full service hotel and some things are just not available. I arrived jetlagged on Sunday and when looking for some food at 8 pm found there was no food available (no room service and restaurant areas closed on Sunday at 5 pm) so I had to go out. No big deal for me, but for some people it would be. Pros: Location downtown (I liked it). Excellent athletic facilities. Very good full breakfast included in the room price. Friendly and helpful front-desk staff. Reasonably-priced ($9 / day) parking in a connected garage. Cons: Location downtown (not everyone will feel comfortable walking around at night -- the neighborhood to the west is quite okay but to the east things get seedy fast). Staff needs some training on the little details. (The morning I had to get up early to make a presentation, I was aghast to find only decaf coffee stocked in the in-room coffee service! Just patchy service, I guess, because the other days there was real coffee and it was pretty good.)

Reviews.Title: “Glad to have stayed here !!!”
Reviews.Author: plannerHaolic
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel while attending a conference and by reading the review I wasn't sure where we would end up. Fortunatelly for us, this happened to be a great choice ! I could relate a lot with what amhp46 wrote just before me ! The room was a bit small but nicely decorated with this old private club look which it used to be, really clean and confortable. We got free internet, a free breakfast buffet with a huge choice and a chef who can cook fresh waffles or eggs/omelette to our liking. Parking fees was only 9 $. A great deal for the location and for what we got ! There is really nice sport and fitness facilities free to use when you stay at the hotel, if you're up to it ! It is also well located a few blocks away from the metro station 2 Dash buses lines at the corner of the street. A good choice of restaurants nearby and a few bars. I never felt in danger in anyway not even when I was visiting alone. The people at the front desk were really nice and helpfull ! I visited while my husband was at his conference. All of their suggestions were valuable. They just added the plus that made our stay there so great. Friends of our stayed at the Hilton Checker's nearby and their room was bigger but they didn't get as much as us and paid more... Next year, they will be coming at the L.A. Athletic Club hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical cookie-cutter chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: amhp46
Reviews.Content: I stayed at LA Athletic Club in October 2009 for business. The rooms are plush and elegant and meant to evoke the atmosphere of a posh historic club. My room was decorated with deep chocolate brown walls, carpet and bedding with touches of cream. The walls have old 1930's photos of athletes to suggest the history of the building. The bed was wonderful--plush and infinitely comfortable with feather pillows and luxurious sheets. My room had a coffee maker, thermostat, plush white bathrobe, mini fridge and flat screen tv. The bathroom was plain but spotless. A good free buffet breakfast is included: bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, custom omlette station, french toast, fruit and cereal bar, fresh juices and coffee. Hotel guest have free access to wifi and the impressive gym facilities. The pool and basketball cours are beautiful but I only used the women's sauna and jacuzzi. Towels, wraps, lockers with keyed locks, lemon water, showers with soap and shampoo are all provided for free. During the weekday evenings when I used the sauna it was almost empty and just wonderful. I found the staff and maid staff to be very friendly and helpful. The first evening, a plate of fruit, cheese, crackers and mints was left in my room. I arrived earlier than I expected and the hotel was very busy with wedding guests but I stepped out for lunch and was able to check-in to my room around 2:00. The bag-check is free. The man at the front desk recommended an excellent French-style bistro, bakery and restaurant (Louie) which was a few blocks away and I ate most of my meals there. The neighborhood is almost abandoned at night since it's the business district but there are a few scattered restaurants, a 7-eleven and a Macy's shopping center within walking distance. The subway is about 2-3 blocks/5 minute walk from the hotel. I came for the Adobe Max conference and it took about half an hour to walk to the convention center. The conference also provided free shuttles to the convention center which I took from the Sheraton hotel, about 2 or 3 blocks (5 minute walk) up the street. I booked the LA Athletic Club because all of the hotels affiliated with the conference were full. I had a friend who stayed at the Sheraton and after seeing their room I was so glad I stayed at the LA Athletic Club--it was less expensive and just had more character . It didn't feel like a cookie-cutter hotel chain and the elegant furnishings, wonderful gym facilities and helpful staff really mad my stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: The Los Angeles Athletic Club is an odd duck as a hotel, which might be why there are so few reviews on Tripadvisor. Most of its 12 story Downtown LA building is taken up with seem to (non-athlete) me to be topflight athletic facilities. There's what I'm pretty sure is a full length, multi-lane swimming pool with a kiddie pool next to it. There's a basketball court that might be full length too. There are exercise machines, a sauna, even a billiard room. The hotel rooms only take up the top 3 floors and there didn't seem to be a whole lot of people staying there one Friday night. I thought they might be there more as a convenience for club members and their families than as a full-fledged hotel. The floor by floor dress code (I kid you not) explained on a paper in my room might fit that image. The rooms are extremely dowdy. The place's elegance has a faded a bit too much, at least in the guest rooms. They're so dowdy that the club plans to renovate them this summer into a richer, retro, yes clubby look. They had photosimulations of the rooms posted on the floor where I stayed. It might have been nice if they'd told us this on the website. For now, the rooms are just tired, the chairs, all the furnishings, the bed lines are all faded. There aren't enough light fixtures in the room, though mine got some eastern natural light, amidst the buildings of Downtown Los Angeles (I liked that part). The carpet was really stained all over the place, not something I normally notice. I don't think there was true dirt around and nothing bit me, but it did add up to a depressing feeling. I'd note parenthetically that I tend to discount complaints on Tripadvisor that something is, horrors, old. Some people seem offended that buildings--like, say, the Waldorf-Astoria--were built more than 10 years ago. But the LA Athletic Club is old in the bad sense. After the renovation it could be much better. I didn't feel a lot of warmth from the people working there. Most were OK, but at least one seemed to be mocking me, not a feeling I usually get in a hotel. Maybe by wearing a daypack backpack I was violating the dress code! It really didn't work well when I tried to check in (at normal time, with a reservation) and the front desk clerk called and called housekeeping to find an available room. Positives: Well located within Downtown LA, close to most Downtown locations and plenty of transit including numerous bus lines and Metrorail lines. They included a free, large, if mediocre breakfast in one of the many dining rooms. City views of a historic part of Downtown LA. A roof deck with nothing but some chairs on it, but even better city views. All those athletic facilities, which might be good with a kid.
